reviews.text: Bit of a one off this place! Indeed, why would you build a modern extension onto a grand old stately home? Anyway to break things down:
reviews.title: Interesting Hotel

reviews.text: The Room: Even though we paid using points, we were allocated an executive room (I am a gold PCR member). The room itself was brilliant, certainly spacious enough for the 6 foot king-sized bed, a cot and space to walk around. There was a 32" LCD on the wall - no HD channels though. The bathroom was also very spacious and clean. There was a separate walk in shower along with a bath. We were a bit worried when reading other reviews that the rooms would be on the small side but we did not see any of the standard rooms. Interestingly there was a notice in reception about upgrading for a fee to an executive room or suite.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

reviews.text: The Public Areas: There is indeed a two mile drive up to the hotel. There are other buildings dotted about the grounds on the drive up, but they do not seem to have any connections to the hotel itself. The car park is a little away from reception, which meant a bit of a slog with your luggage. You can pull up nearer to unload, but with signs saying no stopping/parking we did not bother in the end. The reception area is plush with access to bars and the restaurant.. Received a gold envelope upon checking in, thought there might have been some surprises in it, but alas merely a map of the grounds which were freely available on the reception desk. There are two walks detailed on the map around the grounds - a one and a two mile route.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: The Health Club: This is in a completely separate building. To get there you have to go out of the Crowne Plaza Hotel, head through the Heythrop Park Hotel and then continue outside to the far side of the buildings. Could be up to a 10 minute walk, although there was a porter with a golf buggy if you were not up to it. The pool is nice enough, but fairly shallow. There is a great steam room and Sauna off the poolside, no hot tub though. Kids are allowed in up until 18.30.
reviews.title: Fabulous weekend

reviews.text: A word of warning about food - The nearest pub is the Crown situated in the village of Eynstone, at the bottom of the drive when you turn left. This does not open until 18.30 to serve food, the bar there opens at 18.00. There was another pub if you head right out of the driveway entrance, but this has now closed down. So unless you are prepared for a 6-10 mile roundtrip drive to the next village food choices are limited to the hotel. We ended up having to eat in the hotel which is expensive, but actually very nice food. Mains are priced approx £10-£20. A bottle of the local Hook Norton beer is £4.75! Breakfast is also expensive as mentioned in other reviews - we were offered a 'special deal' of £15 per person when checking in, they also charge £10 for under 12's. We were not prepared to pay £10 for our toddler to have a couple of cornflakes and a sausage! Other IC Hotels usually have free breakfasts for kids - not this Crowne Plaza! Annoyingly checked on the hotel's website once home and it appears they do offer free kids breakfasts after all.
reviews.title: Nice rooms and nice area. Very quiet Sunday night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights in April, I was recouperating from a hip replacement and wanted somewhere quiet with an indoor pool, peace and good walking. We were not dissapointed, the staff are friendly, the rooms just what you needed. The breakfasts were plentiful and the bar meals very good.
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our weekend, walked the grounds, had coffee in the 19th Hole and foudnthe swimming pool just what I needed.
reviews.title: One night stay in May

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the location with my wife for our anniversary.Lovely setting nice sized rooms and comfy beds. More of a business hotel than a family holiday hotel. Would stay there again. Only ussue was walk from car park to reception and minor point my wife is not very tall and some of the chairs in the bar she found uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Excellent location and very attentive staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on Priority Club Points and had an excellent weekend. Having read a number of reviews on this site I was not at all sure what we were going to get but we found the hotel very clean and in an excellent location. The bed was really comfortable and the room had everything you need for a weekend away. Well worth exploring the grounds of the resort if the weather is good, the map given to you on arrival is fine for finding your way around.
reviews.title: A very comfortable and modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff at reception were really welcoming and friendly, both when I telephoned before our visit and throughout our stay. Customer service really well delivered by all at the Crowne Plaza.
reviews.title: a good place to bse yourself
Disappointed
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed here on a group booking for a golf weekend. I don't believe we have ever experienced such a small hotel room. There was no room for two people to move around. There was only one tiny drawer to store things in. The wardrobe contained a fold up stand for storing a suitcase but there was nowhere in the room to put it up. The room had a small window (which could not be opened) & felt dark, adding to the claustrophobic atmosphere. It was more akin to a single room & this impression was reinforced by the fact there was only one bath robe provided & only two tea bags.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were surprised by the sky high price for WiFi in the room particularly in a hotel which is conference orientated. Why oh why do some hotels still insist on charging for WiFi? Furthermore the mobile phone signal was very poor around the hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds were lovely, the golf course had some interesting holes but sadly we won't be hurrying back to the Crowne Plaza Heythrop Park.
reviews.title: We Had a lovely one night's stay in this Fabulous Four Star Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my fiance over the jubilee weekend and had as excellent time and the staff could not have been more helpful. We arrived 1 hour before check in however were given a room that was already available which was a nice start and the service was just as friendly as helpful throughout the stay.
reviews.title: A very relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room itself was nice, not huge however styled really well. The pool, sauna, steam room, golf facilities were of high quality and overall grounds and views were amazing.
reviews.title: Second Rate Experience

reviews.text: Having been offered a room upgrade on my return I looked forward to my stay. Have to say that after my previous experience I was pleased they pulled out all the stops, wine was chilled and food good, but most importantly the staff made my stay a good one. Well done BIG improvement for what could be a top class venue.
reviews.title: What to expect on a seond visit ?

reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel in May 2012 on a beautiful weekend. Great access to Oxford and the surrounding Cotswolds. We had a room with two double beds and a pack-and-play for our baby. The room is fantastic, and they paid attention to the little things. Wash clothes, Shower and Tub, Bath robes, hot water kettle, newspaper.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in a beautiful area

reviews.text: The hotel charges for internet access, which was disappointing.
reviews.title: Fab location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Families - kids are not allowed in the pool after 6:30.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: - there are two places to eat in the hotel, the restaurant and bar
reviews.title: Lovely venue for a wedding
